item.title: Defective resurfacing: uneven surface and loose stones, 28th December
item.description:
The road outside my property was recently resurfaced. Since the works were completed, the surface has already begun to fail. There is a sunken strip and uneven surface across the carriageway, with a pothole now forming within the new tarmac itself. The transition between surfaces is uneven and vehicles are striking it at speed. Loose material is coming away from the surface, and when buses and heavy vehicles pass, there is significant impact noise and vibration which is causing my house to rattle. This issue did not exist prior to the resurfacing works. Given the very recent nature of the works, this appears to be a defective reinstatement rather than normal deterioration.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Whaddon Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Perspex windows missing on shelter, 27th December

item.title: Huge amount of rubbish in the lay-by and beyond, 27th December
item.description:
Heading along the Golden Valley from Cheltenham towards Gloucester in the lay-by the bin is never emptied and the rubbish is overflowing into the lay-by and along the grass verge {what a mess it looks along the gateway from Cheltenham to Gloucester) not a good advertisement for the Arle Court Park and Ride visitors !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
